title: MasOrange says one-third of its 5G network is O-RAN-ready
summary: MasOrange, Spain’s largest operator by customer base, is accelerating its O-RAN deployment with Swedish vendor Ericsson In sum – what to know: Open RAN-ready – One-third of MasOrange’s 5G sites are ready for Open RAN, making it Europe’s largest commercial Open RAN deployment. AI-driven automation – rApps automate network planning, anomaly detection, and energy optimization […]

title: OpenAI and Deutsche Telekom partner up for new AI push

The collaboration centers on deploying advanced AI across Deutsche Telekom’s European operations, with the goal of […]

title: Easy apps, clear ROI, rapid scale – private 5G is going places, says Ericsson
summary: Private 5G is outpacing Wi-Fi for its early growth, and its trajectory is diverging as well. Just as Nokia checks-out, Ericsson argues that a rising tide of high-value industrial use cases is making the case for private 5G very clear – as evidenced in its rapid ROI, and new propensity to global scale.  In sum […]

title: Oracle’s order backlog soars past half a trillion dollars
summary: Free cash flow cratered and capex jumped in Oracle's fiscal Q2 2026, spooking investors. But analysts said the company remains on solid ground.

title: Cisco joins Linux Foundation's new Agentic AI Foundation
summary: Cisco joined the newly-formed Agentic AI Foundation as a launch Gold member, supporting its mission to advance open standards like the Model Context Protocol.

title: Fidium sharpens its focus on data centers and wholesale
summary: Fidium plans to be “just as active” in wholesale fiber as it has been in rural broadband, said incoming CEO Gaurav Juneja.

title: 5G protocol testing explained

But the […]

title: Next wireless and telecom growth wave approaching, driven by AI (Analyst Angle)
summary: Wireless and telecom will be key beneficiaries of the AI revolution As artificial intelligence dominates headlines, boardrooms, and investor conversations, I am increasingly invited into senior-level discussions as companies try to understand what this fast-moving technology means for their future. title: How AI phones will rewrite mobile economics (Analyst Angle)
summary: This whole time, you’ve been your phone’s operating system Here’s the uncomfortable truth about smartphones: For the past fifteen years, you’ve been doing the computer’s job. You’re texting about dinner plans. Someone mentions a restaurant. You copy the address, switch to Maps, paste it, check the route, switch to Calendar, create an event, switch back […]

title: Twenty-thousand leagues under the sea – why sub-sea cable is king
summary: Nearly all international internet traffic – from cloud workloads to streaming video – voyages along a handful of submarine fibre-optic cable highways. These undersea trunks connect continents, power the internet, and underpin the so-called AI ‘supercycle’ – they also make terrestrial cross-border links look like country tracks. In sum – what to know: Sub-sea thoroughfares […]

title: How does 6G keep up with AI? It’s complicated
summary: How do you bake AI into the 6G standard when the typical telco development cycle takes about 10 years and the AI industry is moving at warp speed? The answer, it seems, is not that easy.

title: ‘We. Won’t. Stop.’ — T-Mobile US responds to AT&T lawsuit

title: Samsung, KT validate AI-RAN on commercial networks
summary: Samsung noted it has been advancing AI-RAN technologies that tailor radio configurations based on individual conditions In sum – what to know: AI cuts real-world connection failures – Samsung and KT saw significantly fewer disconnections after applying user-level AI-RAN configurations across a commercial network trial involving about 18,000 users.
